content:
Diagnosis:
Primary peritoneal carcinoma, Stage IV
WT1 positive, PD-L1 negative
Diagnosed March 2024 via laparoscopic biopsy

Previous medical history:
Hypertension
Type 2 diabetes
Hypothyroidism

Current medications:
Carboplatin AUC5 and Paclitaxel 175mg/m2 3-weekly
Metformin 1g BD
Levothyroxine 100mcg OD
Ramipril 5mg OD

Allergies:
None known

Current situation:
Cycle 4 of 6 planned cycles carboplatin/paclitaxel

Disease assessment:
CT 15/05/2024 shows stable disease compared to baseline
CA125 trending down from 1200 to 450

Treatment tolerance:
Grade 2 peripheral neuropathy
Grade 1 fatigue
No significant myelosuppression

I reviewed [redacted name] today prior to cycle 4 chemotherapy. She continues to tolerate treatment reasonably well though experiencing increasing peripheral neuropathy affecting her fingers and toes. This remains grade 2 and she is managing daily activities. Her main symptoms of abdominal bloating and early satiety have improved significantly since starting treatment. Performance status remains 1. Today's blood results show stable renal function and adequate cell counts for treatment. We will proceed with cycle 4 today at full dose but will need to monitor neuropathy closely. Follow-up arranged in 3 weeks for cycle 5, with interim telephone review by specialist nurse. End of treatment CT scan has been booked.

cancer_timeline.value: CT shows stable disease compared to baseline

patient_facts.value: Improved abdominal bloating and early satiety
Stable renal function and adequate cell counts

status_updates.value: Stage IV primary peritoneal carcinoma showing stable disease on carboplatin/paclitaxel with improving symptoms but developing neuropathy
Grade 2 peripheral neuropathy affecting fingers and toes, Grade 1 fatigue
Proceeding with cycle 4 carboplatin/paclitaxel at full dose
End of treatment CT scan booked
Review in 3 weeks for cycle 5 with interim telephone nurse review
